newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombian army destroys huge jungle cocaine labs.
newsitem.headline: Colombian army destroys huge jungle cocaine labs.

text.p: Colombia's army on Monday destroyed a jungle drug processing complex capable of producing 48 tonnes of cocaine a month, military sources said.
Three laboratories and a camp for more than 500 people were discovered near the town of San Jose del Guaviare in Guaviare province in southeastern Colombia.
An army spokesman said one man was arrested and large quantities of chemicals used in cocaine manufacturing were seized. But he said only about four pounds (two kilos) of cocaine was discovered.

The complex was one of the biggest to be found this year. The spokesman said it belonged to the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC), the largest guerrilla army, which the government has routinely accused of drug trafficking. The rebel force's leadership denies the charge.
